BiblioData.Title: PROBE MICROSCOPY AND PROBE POSITION MONITORING APPARATUS
BiblioData.Abstract: A near-field probe microscopy method for collecting sample data. The probe tip of a probe is placed contact with the sample surface or in a near-field region above the sample surface. Probe position monitoring apparatus monitors an at least one dimensional position of the probe tip in a probe tip plane, the probe tip plane being a plane which contains the probe tip and which is substantially parallel to the plane of the sample surface, to generate probe tip position data whereby a change in probe tip position data is representative of a force on the probe tip. In certain embodiments the probe is sufficiently small and soft and the probe position monitoring apparatus is sufficiently sensitive to enable a force on the probe tip which is lower than 1 pN to generate a change in the probe tip position data with a settling time lower than 1 ms. In certain embodiments the probe is less than 1 [mu]m long and/or wide and/or thick.
